title: 103_hr364
content: The "Small Business Meat Producer and Marketer Protection Act of 1993" amends the Small Business Act to ensure fair marketing conditions in the livestock and meat industry for the well-being of businesses and commerce. The "Small Business Meat Producer and Marketer Protection Act of 1993" aims to address marketing conditions that harm the competitive environment and hinder the free flow of commerce in the livestock and meat industry. Congress seeks to eliminate these conditions without significantly impacting production or distribution of products. The "Small Business Meat Producer and Marketer Protection Act of 1993" defines key terms such as commerce, livestock, meat food products, meatpacker, meat marketer, and person.
